channel.title: How do I read the SysEx buttons in from my Artiria Minilab mkII?
channel.description:
How do I read the SysEx buttons of my Arturia Minilab mkII ?
I would like to read the following SysEx messages
> pad 1-8 / 9-16 > In: F0 00 20 6B 7F 42 02 00 00 2F 7F F7 | Sysex > In: F0 00 20 6B 7F 42 02 00 00 2F 00 F7 | Sysex
> shift > In: F0 00 20 6B 7F 42 02 00 00 2E 7F F7 | Sysex > In: F0 00 20 6B 7F 42 02 00 00 2E 00 F7 | Sysex

item.title: How do I read the SysEx buttons in from my Artiria Minilab mkII?
item.dc:creator: @rook rook
item.description:
@rook wrote:

Yeah, it looks like an object on its own can't implement SysEx reads, since the MIDI section doesn't have a signature that would support that. A separate MIDI SysEx section would be appropriate. If that SySex code is actually in the 1.x fw, then it might not be too big a leap to add such a section. I can't tell at a glance because this repo covers both 1.x and 2.x, but if the send code is known to be in there, that's encouraging.

I have a Korg padKontrol I wouldn't mind using in native mode w/ Axoloti, especially since it has a 3 character 7seg display. I even have the code ready to go from an earlier project.

Read full topic
item.source: How do I read the SysEx buttons in from my Artiria Minilab mkII?

item.title: How do I read the SysEx buttons in from my Artiria Minilab mkII?
item.dc:creator: @bart Bart Burkhardt
item.description:
@bart wrote:

Yes I managed to control the LEDS from Axoloti, but that is sending SysEx which is available in the api. To read the buttons I must be reading SysEx messages. Thanks for the reply, Bart

Read full topic
item.source: How do I read the SysEx buttons in from my Artiria Minilab mkII?

item.title: How do I read the SysEx buttons in from my Artiria Minilab mkII?
item.dc:creator: @bart Bart Burkhardt
item.description:
@bart wrote:

Ok, in that case I will try to use the two rotary knobs that have switches that send CC. I would love to work on a custom patch like you describe but I'm afraid I haven't time for that at the moment.Thanks for the reply. Bart

Read full topic
item.source: How do I read the SysEx buttons in from my Artiria Minilab mkII?

item.title: How do I read the SysEx buttons in from my Artiria Minilab mkII?
item.dc:creator: @trimardius
item.description:
@trimardius wrote:

Maybe this thread could be useful?

Arturia Minilab / Beatstep Software
I have a Minilab for testing here and realized I can only get LED feedback from the buttons via Sysex. I found out that for the Beatstep it's the same. I was wondering if anybody here invested in getting this to work with axoloti. As of here it seems that axoloti can send out sysex: EDIT: I just emailed Arturia for the sysex implementation. In case they send it to me would share it here in any case.

Read full topic
item.source: How do I read the SysEx buttons in from my Artiria Minilab mkII?

item.title: How do I read the SysEx buttons in from my Artiria Minilab mkII?
item.dc:creator: @janvantomme Jan Vantomme
item.description:
@janvantomme wrote:

You'll need to write a custom object for that, since SysEx messages will vary depending on the manufacturer. There are some methods in the firmware that may be useful.

github.com

axoloti/axoloti/blob/46f6e4b383ce182da9dcca25b9d4b544fe20f990/firmware/midi_decoder.c

/*
 * midi_decoder.c
 *
 *      Author: jtaelman
 */

#include "ch.h"
#include "midi_decoder.h"


static const unsigned char StatusLengthLookup[16] = {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 3, // 0x80=note off, 3 bytes
                                               3, // 0x90=note on, 3 bytes
                                               3, // 0xa0=poly pressure, 3 bytes
                                               3, // 0xb0=control change, 3 bytes
                                               2, // 0xc0=program change, 2 bytes
                                               2, // 0xd0=channel pressure, 2 bytes
                                               3, // 0xe0=pitch bend, 3 bytes
                                               -1 // 0xf0=other things. may vary.
    };
This file has been truncated. show original
github.com

axoloti/axoloti/blob/46f6e4b383ce182da9dcca25b9d4b544fe20f990/firmware/midi.c

/**
 * Copyright (C) 2013 - 2017 Johannes Taelman

 * A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU General Public License for more details.
 *
 * You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along with
 * Axoloti. If not, see <http://www.gnu.org/licenses/>.
 */
#include "ch.h"
#include "hal.h"
#include "axoloti_board.h"
This file has been truncated. show original
